fertilizerSchedule.notes: Apply around base, avoid contact with stem

pesticideSchedule.safetyNotes: Apply in early morning or evening. Safe for organic farming.
Biological pesticide safe for beneficial insects

environmentalRequirements.airCirculation: Moderate - good air flow prevents fungal diseases

wateringRequirements.notes: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Reduce watering as fruits ripen.

soilRequirements.nutrientsRecommendations: Rich in organic matter. High N during vegetative, high K during fruiting. Ca for blossom end rot prevention.
soilRequirements.notes: Well-draining soil essential. Add compost before planting.

diseasesAndPests.name: Early Blight (Alternaria solani)
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Crop rotation, remove infected leaves, proper spacing for air circulation
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Copper-based fungicides, chlorothalonil. Remove severely infected plants.

diseasesAndPests.name: Blossom End Rot
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Dark, sunken spots on bottom of fruit
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Consistent watering, adequate calcium in soil, avoid over-fertilization with nitrogen
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Calcium foliar spray, improve watering schedule. Not a disease - physiological disorder.

diseasesAndPests.name: Tomato Hornworm
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Large green caterpillars, defoliation, black droppings on leaves
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Hand-pick caterpillars, encourage parasitic wasps, companion planting with marigolds

lightRequirements.notes: Full sun essential for fruit production. In hot climates, afternoon shade acceptable.

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Deep red, uniform color, no green shoulders
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: No cracks, bruises, or blemishes. Perfect shape.

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Red with slight color variation acceptable
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: Minor surface blemishes < 5% of surface area

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Red with some green areas acceptable
gradingStandards.otherCriteria: Suitable for sauce, paste, or canning

economicsAndLabor.notes: Labor intensive crop. Staking, pruning, and harvesting require skilled labor.

additionalInfo.notes: Prune suckers for better fruit production. Determinate varieties also available for bush-type growth.

pesticideSchedule.safetyNotes: Safe for leafy greens. Rinse before harvest.

environmentalRequirements.airCirculation: Good air circulation prevents tip burn and fungal issues

wateringRequirements.notes: Keep consistently moist. Lettuce is 95% water - adequate hydration critical for quality.

soilRequirements.nutrientsRecommendations: High nitrogen for leaf growth. Moderate phosphorus and potassium.
soilRequirements.notes: Light, well-draining soil. Shallow roots require consistent moisture.

diseasesAndPests.name: Tip Burn
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Brown, papery edges on inner leaves
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Consistent watering, adequate calcium, proper ventilation, avoid high temperatures
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Physiological disorder - improve growing conditions. Calcium foliar spray may help.

diseasesAndPests.name: Downy Mildew
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Yellow patches on upper leaf surface, white fuzzy growth on underside
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Good air circulation, avoid overhead watering, resistant varieties
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Copper fungicide, remove infected plants. Preventative measures most effective.

diseasesAndPests.name: Aphids
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Small green/black insects on leaves, sticky honeydew, distorted growth
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Encourage beneficial insects, reflective mulches, companion planting
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Insecticidal soap, neem oil, strong water spray

lightRequirements.notes: Cool-season crop. Too much heat/light causes bolting. Ideal for vertical farming with LED.

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Vibrant green, no yellowing or browning
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: No insect damage, tip burn, or diseases. Tight, compact heads.
gradingStandards.otherCriteria: Crisp texture, fresh appearance, no bolting

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Green, slight outer leaf discoloration acceptable
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: Minor tip burn on outer leaves acceptable (<10% leaves affected)

economicsAndLabor.notes: Fast-growing crop with quick turnover. Ideal for hydroponic/vertical systems. High margin per kg.

additionalInfo.notes: Succession planting recommended every 2 weeks for continuous harvest. Many varieties available (romaine, butterhead, leaf, etc.).

fertilizerSchedule.notes: Build strong root system and runner production
Higher P and K for flower and fruit development
High potassium improves fruit sweetness and firmness

pesticideSchedule.safetyNotes: Apply before flowers open. Do not apply when temperatures exceed 32°C.
Apply in evening to protect bees. Safe for organic production.

environmentalRequirements.airCirculation: Excellent air circulation critical - prevents botrytis (gray mold)

wateringRequirements.notes: Drip irrigation ideal. Avoid wetting fruit and foliage. Reduce watering slightly as fruits ripen for better flavor.

soilRequirements.nutrientsRecommendations: High organic matter. Requires Fe, Mg for chlorophyll. Balanced NPK with emphasis on K during fruiting.
soilRequirements.notes: Slightly acidic soil preferred. Excellent drainage essential to prevent root rot.

diseasesAndPests.name: Botrytis Fruit Rot (Gray Mold)
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Gray fuzzy mold on fruit, brown spots on petals and leaves
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Excellent air circulation, remove plant debris, avoid overhead watering, proper spacing
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Fungicides (captan, thiram). Remove infected fruit immediately. Preventative spraying during bloom.

diseasesAndPests.name: Spider Mites
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Tiny yellow/white specks on leaves, fine webbing, bronzing of foliage
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Maintain humidity, encourage predatory mites, avoid dusty conditions
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Insecticidal soap, neem oil, miticides. Predatory mites (biological control).

diseasesAndPests.name: Verticillium Wilt
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Wilting of outer leaves, brown vascular tissue in crown, plant death
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Use certified disease-free plants, avoid planting after tomatoes/potatoes, soil solarization
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: No cure. Remove and destroy infected plants. Prevent spread by crop rotation.

lightRequirements.notes: Short-day plant - flowering triggered by day length <12 hours. Day-neutral varieties available for year-round production.

gradingStandards.defectTolerance: No defects, bruises, or misshapen fruit. Perfect conical shape.
gradingStandards.otherCriteria: Firm, fresh calyx (green cap), strong aroma, brix >8%

gradingStandards.defectTolerance: Minor shape irregularities, small blemishes <5mm acceptable

economicsAndLabor.notes: Labor-intensive crop, especially harvesting (must pick ripe fruit every 2-3 days). High value crop with excellent profit margins. Perennial in ideal conditions.

additionalInfo.notes: Runners can be used for propagation. Remove runners for larger fruit or allow for new plants. Mulch helps keep fruit clean. Consider using raised beds or vertical systems for easier harvesting and better air circulation.
